{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2984895,"name":"Cadin Cross","username":"Rocket1823","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/94ad74/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-03T21:07:51.633Z","cooked":"

Trying to set up two solenoids and am coming across ERROR -1029. I understand that it is supposed to mean I’m creating a device in an already occupied CAN port, but I can’t for the life of me find where I’m duplicating CAN ports or anything of the sort.

The full error message is:

  • Unhandled exception: edu.wpi.first.hal.util.UncleanStatusException: Code: -1029. HAL: Resource already allocated
  • Error at frc.robot.subsystems.TshirtCannon.(TshirtCannon.java:14): Unhandled exception: edu.wpi.first.hal.util.UncleanStatusException: Code: -1029. HAL: Resource already allocated
  • at edu.wpi.first.hal.SolenoidJNI.initializeSolenoidPort(Native Method)
  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Solenoid.(Solenoid.java:46)
  • at frc.robot.subsystems.TshirtCannon.(TshirtCannon.java:14)
  • at frc.robot.RobotContainer.(RobotContainer.java:30)
  • at frc.robot.Robot.robotInit(Robot.java:48)
  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.TimedRobot.startCompetition(TimedRobot.java:94)
  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.runRobot(RobotBase.java:335)
  • at edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase.startRobot(RobotBase.java:407)
  • at frc.robot.Main.main(Main.java:28)

Heres our code for the cannon:

GitHub

GitHub - PortlandRoboticsTeam/FRC-2021-2022-OFFSEASON

Contribute to PortlandRoboticsTeam/FRC-2021-2022-OFFSEASON development by creating an account on GitHub.

Any help at all would be appreciated.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2022-01-03T21:07:51.633Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":54,"reads":73,"readers_count":72,"score":284.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":398643,"topic_slug":"unhandled-exception-edu-wpi-first-hal-util-uncleanstatusexception-code-1029-hal-resource-already-allocated-at-edu-wpi-first-hal-solenoidjni-initializesolenoidport-native-method","display_username":"Cadin Cross","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/PortlandRoboticsTeam/FRC-2021-2022-OFFSEASON","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":7}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50160,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/unhandled-exception-edu-wpi-first-hal-util-uncleanstatusexception-code-1029-hal-resource-already-allocated-at-edu-wpi-first-hal-solenoidjni-initializesolenoidport-native-method/398643/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":2984898,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-03T21:15:24.971Z","cooked":"

You’re initializing TshirtCannon twice. Once in RobotContainer line 30, Another inside of TshirCannon line 18. Initializing the static INSTANCE variable creates an instance. Since you have RobotContainer, you likely don’t need INSTANCE and can just remove it, and the getInstance() getter.

That worked and solved the problem. Thank you!!
